payload: I have no idea how to start
You can use the chocolate to figure out how many pieces of chocolates can fit along the width of the box.
oh, but how do I use the chocolate and the box together?

To check how many chocolates would fit along the width of the box, take your chocolate and move it along the box. Use your pencil to help you mark on the box to see how many chocolates can be fit along the width.
oh, I still do not completely understand. How can I use the pencil to find out how many chocolates go over the length of the box?
Ah I see, am I doing right like this? I think it fits 15!
By sliding the chocolate along the length of the box and using the chocolate as a reference, you can find that the length would fit 10 chocolates.
